metadata.title: CVE-2024-38627 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: stmclass: Fix a double free in stm_register_device() The put_device(&stm->dev)call will trigger stm_device_release() which frees "stm" so the vfree(stm)on the next line is a double free.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-38627` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-230-generic - 4.15.0-230.242~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-230-generic - 4.15.0-230.242~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-230-lowlatency - 4.15.0-230.242~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1174-aws - 4.15.0-1174.187~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1182-azure - 4.15.0-1182.197~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1167-gcp - 4.15.0-1167.184~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1136-oracle - 4.15.0-1136.147~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
